body_html: @WangNuoWa -- yes, tf.fft/tf.ifft and tf.fft2d/tf.ifft2d should be drop-in replacements for those (though I have never used theano.tensor.fft), perhaps with slightly different normalization strategies though (I see an "ortho" norm in there).
body_text: @WangNuoWa -- yes, tf.fft/tf.ifft and tf.fft2d/tf.ifft2d should be drop-in replacements for those (though I have never used theano.tensor.fft), perhaps with slightly different normalization strategies though (I see an "ortho" norm in there).
body: @WangNuoWa -- yes, tf.fft/tf.ifft and tf.fft2d/tf.ifft2d should be drop-in replacements for those (though I have never used theano.tensor.fft), perhaps with slightly different normalization strategies though (I see an "ortho" norm in there).
